pullRequest.body:
This PR adds `MvPolynomial.finSuccEquiv'`, which is the algebra isomorphism between `MvPolynomial (Fin (n + 1)) R` and `Polynomial (MvPolynomial (Fin n) R)` by identifying the `p`-th variable as the indeterminate.

This generalizes `MvPolynomial.finSuccEquiv` which is only for the `0`-th variable. The supporting theorems for the prime version are identical to the non-prime (current) version, with the non-prime version deduced from the former.

Deletion:
- `support_finSuccEquiv_nonempty`, which is only used in the immediate theorem. I merged the reasoning directly into that theorem. I can revert this change is needed (currently this lemma also has a TODO to be stated more generally).

These changes require new definitions in `Finsupp/Fin`, which is a separate PR.

Co-authored-by: YaÃ«l Dillies <yael.dillies@gmail.com>---

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
